title: Labour faces new civil war after plan to back up PM’s Brexit plans in parliament is exposed
text:
Opinion PLAY NICE Labour faces new civil war after plan to back up PM’s Brexit plans in parliament is exposed 
Leaked memo shows Jeremy Corbyn's chief aide being urged to work alongside Theresa May in Brexit negotiations Exclusive BY HARRY COLE, WESTMINSTER CORRESPONDENT 21st February 2017, 10:00 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LABOUR are drawing up secret plans to work with Theresa May over Brexit — risking a fresh civil war, The Sun can reveal. 
An explosive leaked strategy email shows Jeremy Corbyn’s most senior aide urged to take a “constructive approach” that will risk the party “getting our hands dirty” by not voting against the PM. Reuters 4 Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn could be facing a fresh wave of civil war in the party 
Insiders warn that sticking to Labour’s current position will look like they have “vacated the stage” over Brexit . 
Our revelation comes as it emerged the Tories were increasingly hopeful of a strong result in Stoke Central on Thursday that could knock gaffe-prone Ukip into third at the crunch by-election. 
Such a result would reignite Labour’s bitter civil wars and heap pressure on Jeremy Corbyn to quit. PA:Press Association 4 The leak suggests the Labour Party are keen to work closely with Theresa May on Brexit 
The devastating memo was compiled following a meeting between party grandees and Mr Corbyn’s team on Monday afternoon. 
It was written by former Labour Chief Whip Rosie Winterton and sent to Labour’s strategy boss Seamus Milne following their face to face discussions. 
It slams the hapless Mr Corbyn’s current strategy of claiming the PM is trying to build “a bargain basement” economy after Brexit through lower taxation. 
And it admits that Labour is not currently “facing up to what the detailed agreements should like like” when we have left the EU. Getty Images The memo was written by Labour’s Chief Whip Rosie Winterton PA:Press Association The memo urges Corbyn to use his speech on Friday to signal a change in direction 
It warns that Labour must not be “simply seen to be opposing everything the government does”. 
Citing the previous conversation with Mr Milne, the memo states that Labour must instead “emphasise our constructive approach” that would “show leadership”. 
And it concludes: “We will have to acknowledge that immigration has caused friction in some areas. “Our solution, however, will be that freedom of movement was never meant to be freedom to exploit.” 
The memo urges Mr Corbyn to use his big speech on Brexit planned for this Friday to signal a change in direction. 
Last night a source in the Leader’s office said: “Jeremy and his staff engage regularly with the PLP and are always open to any ideas Labour MPs might have.” 
But furious Lib Dems claimed “Labour have been found out.“ 
Party boss Tim Farron raged: “They are getting behind the government on their Hard Brexit agenda.”
